snippet: The prisoner, Andrei Sannikov, said he was pardoned by President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, a move that might be intended to ease Belarus’s tensions with the European Union.
abstract: Belarus grants early release to one of its most prominent political prisoners, Andrei Sannikov, in a move that might be intended to ease its strained relationship with the European Union; Sannikov was convicted of organizing mass unrest and given a five-year sentence in May 2011, during the harshest crackdown of Pres Aleksandr G Lukashenko's rule.
lead_paragraph: The prisoner, Andrei Sannikov, said he was pardoned by President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko, a move that might be intended to ease Belarus’s tensions with the European Union.

headline.seo: Belarus Frees Andrei Sannikov, a Political Prisoner
headline.main: Prominent Political Prisoner Is Released Early in Belarus
headline.print_headline: Prominent Political Prisoner Is Released Early in Belarus
